principle.name: Atomic and Semantic Commits
principle.description: Make only one meaningful change per commit and follow the semantic commit pattern.
principle.rationale: Facilitates traceability, review, and rollback of changes.

example.good: feat(api): add tenant-level webhook trigger validation

principle.name: Pull Request Automation
principle.description: Always open PRs via MCP, with title and description in English, detailing what was done, why, and how it was tested.
principle.rationale: Standardizes the flow and facilitates auditing.

example.good: Title: feat(api): implement multi-tenant webhook trigger validation Description: This PR adds webhook validation at the tenant level, ensuring data isolation and permission correctness across tenants.

principle.name: Run Linters, Formatters, and Tests
principle.description: Always run pnpm lint && pnpm test before any commit.
principle.rationale: Prevents breakage and maintains code quality.

principle.name: Consult Documentation
principle.description: Always read apps/api/prompts and local prompts before changing code.

principle.name: Professional English
principle.description: All commits, comments, and PRs must be written in clear and professional English.
principle.rationale: Facilitates international collaboration and standardizes communication.

category.name: before finishing
category.item: Open PR via MCP with title and description in English
